entry.title: Fix unsupported roles returning false for aria-checked mixed value
entry.content:
According to the ARIA spec[1], the mixed value is not supported on

radio, menuitemradio, and switch for aria-checked state. Therefore,

user agents must treat a mixed value as false for those roles.



[1]: https://w3c.github.io/aria/#aria-checked

entry.title: [A11y] Fix the aria-valuenow for values within invalid ranges
entry.content:
According to ARIA spec[1], if the aria-valuenow is less than

aria-valuemin, it will be replaced with aria-valuemin, and if it is

greater than aria-valuemax, it will be replaced with aria-valuemax.



[1]: https://w3c.github.io/aria/#authorErrorDefaultValuesTable

entry.title: Use weak pointer in support session started callback.
entry.content:
The use of base::Unretained here is not obviously safe, considering

that the Mojo callback is executed asynchronously. This change uses

a weak pointer instead to prevent UaF issues after the instance of

It2MeNativeMessagingHostLacros is freed.

entry.title: Check for non-zero selection bounds when showing touch selection menu.
entry.content:
Prevent the aura touch selection menu from appearing when the selection

bounds are zero, since this usually means that touch selection is not

active or that there is no cursor or selection. Currently in these

cases, a stray menu ends up incorrectly appearing at the top left of the

screen/app/content while the touch handles are not shown. Since the

touch handles weren't shown, the menu probably shouldn't have been shown

either.



Need to further investigate why the menu is being triggered in these

situations (seems that it is handling a long press context menu event

which it shouldn't handle), but for now just prevent the stray menu from

appearing. This is similar to how empty selection bounds are handled in

views so I think it should be ok:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/views/touchui/touch_selection_controller_impl.cc;l=739;drc=8f8154598d766545ee1e8234f93a895659f62434



(Also fix a test so that it waits for selection updates to occur before

checking whether the menu is shown, since this change means that the

menu won't be shown if no caret or selection has been set.)



Bug: 1470581, b:286348351

Change-Id: Ieae03fe5cd615ebc8c70b42382c6dcf28ca83f7c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4755023

Commit-Queue: Michelle Chen

entry.title: tracing: use default ShmemMode in creating the arbiter
entry.content:
This CL is a manual roll of perfetto with a fix in Chrome. The perfetto

upstream introduces the ShmemMode parameter in creating the

SharedMemoryArbiter in aosp/2627899 and causes breakage in tracing. Fix

by passing ShmemMode::kDefault (supporting cross-process Shmem) in

creating the arbiter. Also include a fix of perfetto unittest for

fuchsia (aosp/2696480).



This CL manually rolls perfetto from 446adf5b7bb4 to 8e8917c609bd

(36 revisions).

https://android.googlesource.com/platform/external/perfetto.git/+log/446adf5b7bb4..8e8917c609bd

entry.title: [ios] Improve SessionRestorationWebStateObserver
entry.content:
The SessionRestorationServiceImpl will be responsible for creating and

destroying the SessionRestorationWebStateObserver instance. It ensures

that the objects will be destroyed before the WebState themselves, so

the `web_state_` will always be valid and can be marked as `const`.



Fix the unittests to destroy the object before destroying the WebState.

entry.title: Revert "Refactor PageIconCookiesContentView"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 627ac6299a0071adb9116957b6d6273385daaf72.



Reason for revert: PageInfoBubbleViewBrowserTestCookiesSubpage test failures:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-ubsan-vptr/24889/overview



Original change's description:

> Refactor PageIconCookiesContentView

>

> This change refactors this class into a base class with two

> implementations:

>

> - OldPageInfoCookiesContentView: an old implementation of the UI used

> with Chrome Guard.

>

> - PageInfoCookiesContentView: a new design consistent and used with

> User Bypass (the new cookie controls UI).

entry.title: [Tracing w/SDK] Implement Start/Stop for memory_instrumentation
entry.content:
The "org.chromium.memory_instrumentation" datasource registered itself

in the SDK build, but did nothing. The memory instrumentation was

implemented as a TraceLog observer instead, which could create

problems in the presence of multiple simultaneous tracing sessions

(e.g. it would fail to start if another track_event session was

active).



This CL makes it a proper datasource that is configured independently

of track_event. It can now start/stop correctly in the presence of

multiple track_event sessions. Also memory dumps go only into those

sessions that have the datasource configured. It still doesn't support

multiple instances of itself though, so only one session can receive

memory dumps at a time.



Bug: b/237761718

entry.title: Commit Autocompletion when User presses physical <Tab> key.
entry.content:
The change permits key (alongside and keys) to

commit autocompletion in cases where autocompletion is available.



When eligible key is pressed, and autocompletion is available, the

logic consumes the key, and does not propagate it further. This is

done to suppress cases where there are multiple handlers for a given

key combination available - for example key is also used to move

focus to the next focusable item.



The eligible keys are only propagated if autocompletion is not

available, e.g. permitting key to move focus to the next Action

chip on selected suggestion, or permitting key to activate

suggestions.



The change also ensures the key properly activates

suggestions. Presently, we propagate only OnKeyDown events. The View

class arms an internal watch for a corresponding OnKeyUp event, and if

one is not offered, assumes a LongClick event, rather than regular

Click event.



Resolving this properly will take more time; until then, we will

capture and process keys by ourselves.



Change-Id: If331142e1d38d3b6cdfd7c216899b58d1cd0a0e6

Fixed: 1379810

entry.title: [@scope] Support selector filtering for :scope
entry.content:
This CL propagates the StyleScope (if any) to SelectorFilter, such that

we can "dereference" :scope selectors into their associated scoping

root selectors.



This optimization should be a good match for the default "mode" of

scoped selectors, since scoped selectors (in the normal case)

are prepended with an implicit descandant-combinated :scope selector:



@scope (.a) {

.b { ... } /* Equivalent to ":scope .b { ... }". */

}



AtScopeAncestor.html results, release build with DCHECK:



Without CL: avg 625 ms

With CL: avg 52 ms



The exact numbers above are not important, as long as there's a clear

difference between the two.



Bug: 1280240

Change-Id: Iad3e21a06c159b87e8e66e38fb713d53882190b5

entry.title: Cookie Controls: Reset Controls Controller info on new WebContents
entry.content:
Previously, when a new page was loaded, the CookieControlsController

reset information about what the initial page setting was.



This CL extends that, to also reset information when a new

WebContents is set, such as when a user changes tabs.



Extensive UI testing is included, as this was the simplest way to

invoke all the required interactions to elicit a failure without the

fix.

entry.title: [Android][3PPWM] Reflect options model changes in radio buttons
entry.content:
This CL introduces a custom component with two radio buttons.

The newly added ViewBinder maps the boolean model state of the pref

to the integer selection options represented by the radio buttons.

The selection of either button triggers the callback that updates

the pref.



Additionally, the Fragment adds help and feedback. It contains no

logic and is injected into the view directly and constant after

injection. Therefore, representing its state in the model is not

significant enough to justify the boilerplate.



Strings and mocks (linked in the bug) are far from being final.

Screenshots are at crbug.com/1469795#c4.

entry.title: media/gpu/vea_tests: Use default PSNR tolerance in scaling test case
entry.content:
The PSNR tolerance given by --psnr-threshold is ignored in the scaling

test case. It is because the PSNR threshold is for the original video

resolution, but the output resolution in the test case is 1/4 of the

input video resolution. Therefore, the PSNR value is reduced. Since

the appropriate PSNR tolerance is unknown, we use the default

tolerance in the test case.

entry.title: Fix a DCHECK with “will-change: contents” on partial MPC hits.
entry.content:
This was probably a long-standing issue that was only recently uncovered

with the added DCHECKs that things came out right after a partial MPC hit.

The issue is that we relied on setting will-change (which was marked as

noninherited) to set WillChangeContentsSubtree (which was marked as

inherited). So if we got a partial MPC hit, we would copy over all

noninherited properties from the MPC entry, and skip applying will-change.

But the inherited property WillChangeContentsSubtree would _not_ get

copied, and also, nothing would set it (it would stay at its initial

value of false, inherited from the parent), and thus, it would be the

wrong value.



We now do this pseudo-inheritance with yet another hack in StyleAdjuster

instead.



Bug: 1469858, 1470253, 1470406, 1470689

entry.title: Fenced frame: Add WPT for loading an invalid FencedFrameConfig.
entry.content:
Since FencedFrameConfigs can now be serialized and passed through

`window.postMessage()`, it is possible for a FencedFameConfig to be sent

to a context that can't load it. A fenced frame config is only valid

if it is in the same page that it was created in. (Each

FencedFrameURLMapping lives inside PageImpl).



This CL adds a test to make sure that if a FencedFrameConfig is sent

outside of the page it was created in, no navigation is allowed to

happen.

entry.title: [@scope] Store bucket information outside of RuleData
entry.content:
RuleData currently has a memory optimization where we "borrow"

the area ultimately used to store bloom filter hashes during

construction of the RuleSet. A consequence of this optimization is that

we delay computation of the bloom filter hashes until the end of

RuleSet::Compact. This technique conflicts with our plan to support

bloom filtering for @scope'd rules, because the relevant @scope for

a given RuleData is only known around the time of RuleData construction.



This CL restores the old behavior of computing bloom filter hashes

during RuleData's constructor. However, since de-unionifying the

bucket_number_/order_in_bucket_ members of RuleData would consume

too much memory (measurements have shown 20k+ RuleData instances on

modern sites), we store "BucketData" objects in a separate vector

which is cleared at the end of RuleSet::Compact.



The style perftest seems to be neutral for this CL.



Bug: 1280240

Change-Id: Ie4940922f57693f211e1595775ab58ba29424b4b

entry.title: Revert "SearchPre: [N.1] use refptr to keep StreamingSearchPrefetchURLLoader"
entry.content:
This reverts commit f626b7fd02f281a3ae4c59e5b420ee36f053a4dc.



Reason for revert: likely causes SearchPreloadUnifiedFallbackBrowserTest.PrerenderDiscardedBeforeServingData test failure, example failure: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ASan%20LSan%20Tests%20(1)/117727/overview



Original change's description:

> SearchPre: [N.1] use refptr to keep StreamingSearchPrefetchURLLoader

> alive during serving.

>

> Now SearchPrefetchURLLoader::RequestHandler can be executed

> asynchronously, so it is unsafe to use unique pointer to manage the

> loader's lifetime anymore, and the previous CR comments mentioned.

>

> This CL turns to using a scoped_refptr, so that the loader would not be

> deleted as long as it is still serving.

> And now the lifecycle is managed by Mojo.

>

> https://docs.google.com/document/d/1szrOWEV0KpV5bPpWcru8PwnKioM4kvCkCylxqhX6m8o/edit#bookmark=id.k2il17hzyry5

>

> Bug: 1400881, 1463000

> Change-Id: Ifbb551c222717b824f164bdd7da52aac27978eb4

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4344832

> Commit-Queue: Lingqi Chi

> Reviewed-by: Hiroki Nakagawa

> Reviewed-by: Hiroshige Hayashizaki

> Reviewed-by: Kouhei Ueno

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1180711}



Bug: 1400881, 1463000

entry.title: [infra] Increase experiment_percentage of Siso CQ builders to 50%
entry.content:
The initial build metrics are worse than the target builders.

This CL increase the experiment_percentage to reduce the # of revisions

since the last build.



The Siso CQ builders disable tests. So it shouldn't increase workloads

on the test pool.

It also would be able to handle more builds since they don't run tests.

entry.title: Refactor PageIconCookiesContentView
entry.content:
This change refactors this class into a base class with two

implementations:



- OldPageInfoCookiesContentView: an old implementation of the UI used

with Chrome Guard.



- PageInfoCookiesContentView: a new design consistent and used with

User Bypass (the new cookie controls UI).



Common functionality remains in the base class, but views code & Views

distinct to one or the other are now in one of the two derived classes.

entry.title: Split browser forms into renderer forms before passing them to PWM.
entry.content:
This CL splits browser forms into renderer forms to match password

manager's notion of a "form" and to allow password manager to match

the Autofill server predictions with form data it has recorded within

its own renderer component.



Although the change is a bug fix, it is wrapped inside a feature to

act as a potential "kill switch".

entry.content:

The problem was in the table view which was bigger (due to the longer

labels in affected languages) than the fixed popup width.

It's been fixed by setting the fixed width aligned with the table size,

as UpdateAddressProfileView is only a delegate it can control

the popup width via the `set_fixed_width()` method only.

entry.title: Remove cross-thread task in ForceEncodeRowsOnCurrentThread
entry.content:
From the function name, "ForceEncodeRowsOnCurrentThread" sounds like

it can be called from various different threads, but it looks like

it's always called from the context thread. This makes the

PostCrossThreadTask unnecessary, since we're already on the right

thread for invoking CreateBlobAndReturnResult.



Drop the "OnCurrentThread" suffix from the function name, since it's

not really running on any special thread vs. the other suffix-less

functions in this class.



This CL eliminates one use of CrossThreadPersistent. Subsequent

CLs in this chain will eventually eliminate the other uses.

entry.title: AutofillProfile: Only increment use count if 60sec passed.
entry.content:
With AutofillSuggestionsForAutocompleteUnrecognizedFieldsOnMobile,

filling forms fully annotated with ac=unrecognized degenerates to field

by field filling on mobile. To ensure that use counts (used to order

profiles in suggestions) are not skewed by this, this CL adds logic to

increment the use count only if at least 60sec have passed.



This will also be useful when field by field filling is implemented.

entry.title: [Glanceables] Add focus ring to classroom item view
entry.content:
Add a focus ring for each classroom item view. The focus ring has

rounded corners which match the item views corners exactly. To achieve

this, each item view has its rounded corners set individually, where the

first item has a larger corner radius on top corners, and the last item

has a larger corner radius on bottom corners. This is now calculated

for each item view, instead of clipping the whole item list container

with larger rounded corners.

entry.title: Add kSpeculativeServiceWorkerWarmUpOnInsertedIntoDom feature param
entry.content:
This CL adds kSpeculativeServiceWorkerWarmUpOnInsertedIntoDom feature

param to kSpeculativeServiceWorkerWarmUp feature. When

kSpeculativeServiceWorkerWarmUpOnInsertedIntoDom is true, all the links

in the document will be sent to the browser process.



kSpeculativeServiceWorkerWarmUpOnInsertedIntoDom processes the URL

candidates with FIFO order instead of LIFO. This is because we want to

process the URLs from the top of the document. For other warm-up modes

that are triggered by mouse events or link visibility uses LIFO because

the latest events have more chance to be navigated.



This CL also removes query from URL when sending the URL to browser to

reduce the sending URL count.

entry.title: [Passwords] Ignore OTP fields in UsernameFirst/ForgotPassword flows
entry.content:
When users type in text fields, PasswordManager is notified about

potential usernames for Username First or Forgot Password flows.

Fields that are labeled by the developer as OTP fields should be

ignored. This patch adds a check for OPT_related HTML attributes

and for the input length.



The input length is checked on the renderer side, and HTML attribute

info is porpagated to the browser side, to enable overriding it in

case of an error.

entry.title: Delay fio-dlc install until oobe is complete
entry.content:
OOBE calls to update-engine as soon as network is available. The

simultaneous callt to dlcservice is causing update-engine and dlcservice

to deadlock on each other for 25s until dbus times out.



By delaying the install until OOBE is complete, we are less likely to

have any other calls to update-engine running at the same time.



Bug: b/270003192

entry.title: WebNN: Define DirectML Node for reshape MLOperator
entry.content:
This CL implements the CreateOperatorNodeForReshape() method for WebNN

reshape MLOperator. The DirectML API does not have a real Reshape

operator. The WebNN Reshape is implemented by creating a new NodeOutput

for the input Node. The new NodeOutput has the reshaped dimensions and

is used as the output of the WebNN Reshape operator.



Because there is no real Reshape operator in DirectML graph, when the

input and output of the Reshape are exactly the input and output of the

graph, an Identity operator is inserted to copy the input tensor to the

output tensor.



For unit tests, this CL adds cases that checks the build status of

Reshape operator. Will add cases to check the compute results of Reshape

operator later.



Bug: 1273291

Change-Id: I16d99494a590a24f4f310c6ffaded2cb4c810ffc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4727470

entry.title: [Profiles] Fire removed-profile when omitting and removing it from list
entry.content:
This CLs fixes a bug that was introduced when setting the profile to

omitted after it's marked for deletion.



When deleting the profile on the Profile Picker, a dialog is open to

confirm the deletion. After confirming it, the dialog was not being

closed because profile-removed was not fired since the profile is now

omitted and removed from the profiles list. So it is now fired when

first removing the profile from the list, after it is turned to omitted.

entry.title: Avoid HashMap of Member in CustomHighlightMarkersNotOverlapping
entry.content:
In case a GC happens while the HashMap is used, any objects referred

to only from the HashMap will be considered unreachable by the GC and

will be reclaimed. This can lead to UAF and memory corruptions.

Using a HeapHashMap instead solves the issue.

entry.title: Avoid Vector of GCed in AllMediaConstraintSets
entry.content:
In case a GC happens while the Vector is used, any objects referred

to only from the Vector will be considered unreachable by the GC and

will be reclaimed. This can lead to UAF and memory corruptions.

Using a HeapVector instead solves the issue.
